title: Martins
body: Frutuoso refers to Cristovão Martins de Grinão, nicknamed 'o Peru', and to Vasco Martins Moniz, noble men who lived in Funchal in the 15th century. Dr. Azevedo also mentions a Spaniard named Diogo Martins, to whom Queen D. Catarina granted arms in 1560. During the time when the French plundered Funchal, Cristovão Martins and the finance clerk João Martins resided here, and among the individuals who signed the vote document in which S. Tiago Menor was taken as the patron saint of the city, Fernão Martins appears, but it is unknown if he belonged to the nobility of the island.

1560: D. Catarina granted arms to Diogo Martins
